CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1952, pg. 3 reads: "Medical Technicians' Display - An exhibit which displays the role of the modern medical laboratory technician in present-day hospital treatment was shown at the Buhl Planetarium last week. Here Miss Catherine Schwan of the Blood Bank and Miss Frances Barr, bacteriology technologist from the staff of Pittsburgh Hospital are shown explaining the medical technologist's role at the exhibit. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Catherine Schwan looking in microscope and Frances Barr holding finger of girl, gathered at an exhibit for medical laboratory technicians with signs in background reading "Mercy Hospital" "A medical technologist to the laboratory under a... blood count" and "Causes Of Anemia...Deficiencies," in Buhl Planetarium
